item.title: Natick's 'model' employee
item.description: When Steve Smith was growing up in Wayland, Mass., he would go to a movie like "Star Wars," rush home, and try to replicate the technology he had seen using parts from models that he had already built.

item.title: Tight budget may force involuntary separations
item.description: The involuntary separation of Soldiers from the force may be necessary as the Army draws down in strength over the next few years, the service's vice chief of staff told members of Congress.

item.title: SecArmy implores: 'Take back your Army' from sexual predators
item.description: Secretary of the Army John M. McHugh, along with Army Chief of Staff Gen. Ray Odierno and Sgt. Maj. of the Army Raymond F. Chandler III, were the featured speakers at a Pentagon ceremony marking the start of Sexual Assault Awareness Month, observed in April.

item.title: Fort Belvoir hosts new Cyber Defense Training Program
item.description: Fort Belvoir, Va., played host to the Cyber - Digital Master Gunner Solution Course, March 3-21, 2014.

item.title: Fort McCoy uses prescribed burns to cut wildfire chance, help habitats
item.description: The first prescribed burn of the year at Fort McCoy, Wis., was executed March 14, 2014, along the railroad grade that extends through the South Post range areas.

item.title: Soldiers outfitted with advanced hearing protection
item.description: As early as 2012, the Department of Defense announced plans of integrating technologically sophisticated, yet tactical, hearing protection devices for Soldiers engaged in overseas combat operations and local training exercises.

item.title: Handheld inspection tool will increase food safety for Soldiers
item.description: The U.S. Army Natick Soldier Research, Development and Engineering Center is working to develop a small, sensitive, hand-held device that will both capture and detect dangerous pathogens that can cause food-related illness.

item.title: Soldiers ready for World Cup on home range
item.description: Seven Soldiers from the U.S. Army Marksmanship Unit will join members of the U.S. National Shooting Team to compete in the International Shooting Sports Federation World Cup starting today, at the USAMU's Pool International Range Complex and Phillips Range on Fort Benning, Ga.

item.title: Carson sworn in as 31st Under Secretary of U.S. Army
item.description: Secretary of the Army John McHugh swore in Brad R. Carson as the 31st Under Secretary of the Army and Chief Management Officer of the Army, during an informal ceremony amongst family, friends and colleagues at the Pentagon.

item.title: Army medic honored as 'angel of battlefield'
item.description: Sgt. Kristopher Ritterhouse was honored for rushing to aid Soldiers during a battle in Afghanistan, despite having just suffered a traumatic brain injury.

item.title: CSA: Army watching Eastern Europe closely
item.description: The Army and NATO are watching "very carefully" the troop deployments and the exercises they're doing in Russia, Army Chief of Staff Gen. Ray Odierno told members of Congress during a House Appropriations Committee, Defense subcommittee budget hearing, March 27, 2014.

item.title: G-1 testifies: Army must balance quality of life, readiness, modernization
item.description: The Army G-1 told members of the House Armed Services Committee that with sequestration will come a slowdown in Soldier compensation and benefits in order to maintain readiness and modernization.

item.title: New instructional methods challenge students to become critical thinkers
item.description: Skills-Based Training, which is a new instructional method implemented at the Ordnance School at Fort Lee, Va., has gradually gained acceptance and support.

item.title: Reserve Soldiers respond to dangerous truck accident
item.description: Three Soldiers from the 3rd Battalion, 348th Regiment, were among the first to respond to an overturned 18-wheeled tractor-trailer carrying flammable material on Interstate-59 in Hattiesburg, Miss., March 11, 2014.

item.title: Airmen team with Army depot to learn 'Lean' process
item.description: Air Force aircraft maintenance mechanics recently teamed up with Tobyhanna Army Depot employees to standardize processes for work performed on a satellite communications system and tactical radios.

item.title: U.S. Army Marksmanship Unit shotgun shooters qualify for World Championships
item.description: Three more shotgun shooters from the U.S. Army Marksmanship Unit earned a trip to the International Shooting Sports Federation World Championships scheduled for the fall.

item.title: McKiernan meets Korean War legend in Seoul
item.description: The Eighth Army deputy commander for operations met a Korean War legend and honorary Eighth Army commanding general in Seoul, South Korea, March 25, 2014.

item.title: First female National Guard Soldiers graduate Field Artillery School
item.description: Four female National Guard Soldiers graduated from the Artillery School at the 139th Regimental Training Institute, at Fort Bragg, N.C., March 19, 2014.

item.title: SecArmy: Readiness shouldn't be political football
item.description: "This is the time for protection and predictability, not politics," Secretary of the Army John M. McHugh told lawmakers of the House Armed Services Committee, March 25, 2014, in Washington, D.C.

item.title: 3rd Inf. Div. leaders reinforce Army's commitment to eliminate sexual harassment, assault
item.description: Senior leaders from the 3rd Infantry Division, at Fort Stewart, Ga., gathered at Club Stewart, March 21, 2014, to openly discuss the way ahead for sexual harassment / assault response and prevention in the Army.

item.title: Guard, Soldiers fly manned, unmanned aircraft, train together
item.description: Initial entry training Soldiers assigned to the 2-13th Aviation Regiment, at Fort Huachuca, Ariz., and Army National Guard members assigned to the 1-285th Armed Reconnaissance Battalion, from Silverbell Army Heliport in Marana, Ariz., have recently combined their training efforts using a concept known as manned/unmanned teaming operations.

item.title: Soldiers train for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosive defense mission
item.description: Soldiers with the 566th Area Support Medical Company, conducted field training March 17-19, 2014, at Fort Hood, Texas, to certify them for their assumption of the Defense CBRNE (Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosive) Reactionary Force mission.

item.title: U.S. Army leaders discuss transformation in Korea
item.description: U.S. Army leaders are gathering to discuss transformation in South Korea, March 25-27, 2014.

item.title: Natick study examines effects of stress on Soldiers' immune systems, cognitive ability
item.description: Training and operations can put such tremendous physical and psychological stresses on warfighters that their immune systems and their ability to respond to threats may be compromised.

item.title: Army manufacturer seeks to raise its quality, confidence of infantrymen
item.description: Watervliet Arsenal, N.Y., recently announced that it was bringing on line more than $26 million of new or enhanced manufacturing capability this fiscal year. Part of this enhanced capability involves improving the arsenal's quality control.

item.title: Human Resources Command stands up Cyber Branch
item.description: U.S. Army Human Resources Command established a provisional Cyber Branch, March 20, 2014, to provide career management, development and readiness to the Army's cyber forces.

item.title: Vice chief opens high school leadership, ethics conference
item.description: Vice Chief of Staff of the Army Gen. John F. Campbell served as keynote speaker for the seventh annual "West Point Leadership and Ethics Conference," March 20, 2014, at George Mason University in Arlington, Va.

item.title: Big Red One Soldiers thrive with help from Comprehensive Soldier and Family Fitness
item.description: How do hula hoops and buckets of ice make a company better? For Capt. Erik Anthes, commander of Forward Support Company (Easy Red), 1st Battalion, 16th Infantry Regiment, 1st Armored Brigade Combat Team, 1st Infantry Division, Fort Riley, Kan., these are tools for achieving an incredible turnaround for his company.

item.title: Army Emergency Relief calls for community support
item.description: The Army Emergency Relief campaign runs until May 15, 2014, and raises money for military personnel in need through community donations.

item.title: Air and missile defense to get smarter software
item.description: New equipment that may soon integrate missile and air defense systems was demonstrated at the Pentagon this week, including the integrated fire control network relay, engagement operation center and the integrated collaborative environment.
